meanings.sent1: After the storm passed, the sun began to relumine the whole sky.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight battery died, but a new one helped relumine the path.
meanings.sent3: The firefly decided to relumine its light just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile relumined the room, bringing warmth to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse relumined the dark sea, guiding ships safely.

meanings.sent1: The stars relumine the night sky after the clouds disperse.
meanings.sent2: The diamond lost its sparkle but relumined after being cleaned.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball decided to relumine its lights for one more dance.
meanings.sent4: His eyes relumined with joy when he saw his long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The city lights relumined the horizon, creating a beautiful view.

meanings.definition: The act of shining brightly again
meanings.sent1: The relumine of the candle brought light back to the room.
meanings.sent2: The relumine of the fireworks lit up the night sky once more.
meanings.sent3: The relumine of the disco ball made everyone start dancing again.
meanings.sent4: The relumine of her smile brightened up the whole party.
meanings.sent5: The relumine of the sunrise painted the sky with vibrant colors.
